intro: Sisymbrium commune, commonly known as wild radish, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has pinnately divided leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are followed by elongated, slender pods containing several seeds. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been naturalized in various regions around the world. Sisymbrium commune is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in fields, and it plays a role in soil stabilization and as a food source for insects.
